intro: Lasiosiphon burchellii var. villosus, commonly known as the hairy lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
